title.narrative: Emergency WASH Response to drought-affected communities in Jubaland and South West State of Central South Somalia

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to provide Emergency WASH Response to drought-affected communities in Jubaland and South West State of Central South Somalia. The key WASH activities to be implemented are: Rehabilitation and upgrade with handpumps and solar systems of 45 strategic water systems -including shallow wells fitted with hand pumps, construction of 250 new latrines in the IDP settlement to reach 7,500 people, emergency supply of clean safe water access by water trucking to 115,000 drought-affected populations for between 30-45 days, Hygiene kit distribution and hygiene promotion to reach 60,000 people and 140,000 people including 25,200 men, 29,400 women, 42,00 boys,43,400 girls, and including 7,000 people living with disabilities are targeted for assistance.
